name: LogicCity Jr
description:
Logic puzzle game to build problem solving, reasoning, critical thinking skills that are the foundation of coding, math, and science. (for ages 6-11). Designed by a very experienced math professor of education.

"Although addictively fun, LogicCity Jr. has serious educational chops and works with developing a child’s ability to think and reason independently" - TeacherswithApps

Kids who like coding, math, puzzles, board games love it. It's easy to learn, and gradually gets really challenging!

Here's a video made by kids who tried it during a coding camp in school: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzuZh_uTqyc&list=PLfxHXbzcDENvUTLeVHNHMDJ9OHRtY7bvZ

** Winner ** Silver Medal, International Serious Play Awards

"My eight year old son loves this game. It has quickly become one of his favorite and most used apps .... My son has really improved his critical thinking skills and his teacher in school asked what has gotten him thinking more."Apppicker parent reviews

The goal of the game is simple, to fill the grid with shapes, without repeating a shape in a row or column (yes, like sudoku !). But wait - there's more ! You have to manage the colors and the shapes simultaneously - adding a whole new dimension to sudoku.

"LogicCity Jr provides a completely kid-friendly experience from start to finish" Apppicker. Contains No Ads.

For our elementary school age users, these logic puzzles aim to develop problem solving and critical thinking skills to an advanced level without needing to get into any complicated formulas - just pure logic, and deduction. These skills can then really help them understand and enjoy math and are useful in so many other ways. We've tried them out with several elementary school children, and they kept wanting to do more.

Note : 50% discount for bulk purchases of 20 or more (per apples VPP)

For adult puzzle lovers, it's also fun to play with them. It's a nice break when you want to put your feet up but keep your mind engaged or do something different from everyday life. You can go to the later levels straight - they get pretty challenging !

These puzzles have been developed by Michel Lyons and Arunima. Michel is the creator of several popular and highly rated board puzzle games such as Metaform, Architecto .. etc. He has also written math curriculum books with a focus on problem solving.

Questions, comments, suggestions - you can reach us at arunima@mindsonplay.com

Even more challenging puzzles coming soon ... We hope you have a good time with it !
